description: — The black bear is a forest-dwelling omnivore that usually is not dangerous unless an interloper threatens its cubs or food supply. These long, lean carnivores are slightly taller than brown bears. Black bears can be pure black, blond, or cinnamon in color and are rarely more than 5 feet long. description: — These herd animals can be aggressive when protecting young and during the mating season, but they generally prefer flight to fighting. Camels are known for their ability to travel long distances without A bison stands more than 6 feet tall at the shoulder and is 9 to food or water. 12 feet long. It weigh 1,800 to 2,400 pounds. The bison’s statistics The statistics presented here are for the dromedary, or one- can be used for almost any large herd animal. humped camel, which thrives in warm deserts. A dromedary stands about 7 feet tall at the shoulder, with its hump rising 1 foot higher. Combat The two-humped, or Bactrian, camel is suited to cooler, rocky Stampede (Ex): A frightened herd of bison flees as a group in a areas. It is stockier, slower (speed 40 feet), and has a higher Con- random direction (but always away from the perceived source of stitution score (16). danger). They literally run over anything of Large size or smaller Carrying Capacity: A light load for a camel is up to 300 that gets in their way, dealing 1d12 points of damage for each five pounds; a medium load, 301–600 pounds; and a heavy load, bison in the herd (Reflex DC 18 half ). The save DC is Strength- 601–900 pounds. A camel can drag 4,500 pounds. based.
